content: ali hat by susan ashcroft yarn dk worsted or aran weight - be sure to check gauge approx 120-150m / 130-165 yds more for a slouchy hat recommended needle size 4 5mm/us7 knitting in the round use your favourite technique for the crown you can use dpn s 2 circulars magic loop or just work on a single circular and pick up the slack you can find more yarn ideas and projects hedgehog fibres merino dk on 4 5 mm us7 linked to the pattern page on ravelry - link you ll also be able to see exact yardage used for different hats size approx 50-55cm 20-22 gauge 18 sts per 4 /10cm in pattern gauge isn t critical because the hat has some give but should be close-ish or else your hat won t be the same size to swatch on rs - knit all sts on ws * slip 1 purlwise with yarn in front k1 repeat from * abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es rs/ws = right side/wrong side sl1 = slip 1 st purlwise wyib for main pattern for slipping instructions for swatch see above ssk = slip 2 stitches separately knitwise then knit them together through the back loops hedgehog fibres merino aran on 4 5mm us7 © ashcroft-hempsall 2017 - for personal non-commercial use only ali hat 2 getting started cast on 90 or 96 sts for a larger hat - use cable cast-on make sure it s firm and even but not too tight the blogpost linked below explains how i hold the base of the stitches to keep it from being too tight link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html note - if you wish to substitute other stitch counts use a multiple of 10 or 12 knit one round and then join - so that you get the nice edge at the bottom this version of the hat is designed with no cuff as shown in the photos if you turn up the cuff you ll get a different texture showing place a marker for the start of the round be sure not to twist your sts check when you start round 2 because you can still untwist then tip try on your hat after a few rounds to check the fit working the main section r1 sl1 p1 to the end of the round r2 knit all sts repeat rounds r1 and r2 until you are ready to work the crown stopping after a r1 the crown is quite short so for a beanie work until you have a palm-sized hole at the top for slouchy just knit longer before starting the crown crown for 96 sts multiple of 12 crown for 90 sts multiple of 10 cr1 ssk k8 x 9 c1 ssk k10 x 8 cr2 *sl2 p1 sl1 x 3 p1 repeat from * to end c2 *sl2 p1 sl1 x 4 p1 repeat from * to end cr3 ssk k7 to
